New Records: Lautaro Martínez scored twice, helping Argentina secure a 2-0 victory over Peru in their Copa America group stage match.
Argentina became the first team to win all three of their group stage matches in the Copa America this century, a feat last achieved in 2007 and 2016.
Lautaro Martínez is the top scorer in the 2024 Copa America with four goals, ahead of Lionel Messi and Luis Díaz.
Key Match Events: Argentina struggled to break down Peru in the first half, with only one meaningful chance from Alejandro Garnacho in the opening 25 minutes.
Peru failed to threaten, managing just six shots on target, with an expected goals total of 0.14.
Lautaro Martínez scored twice, with his second goal coming in the 86th minute, sealing the victory for Argentina.
Peru's starting forward line of Bryan Reyna, Paolo Guerrero, and Edison Flores failed to create any shots on target, making it a tough ask against the defending champions.
Pre-Game Insights: Lionel Messi was missing due to a groin injury, forcing Lautaro Martínez to step up as Argentina's key player.
Peru needed a win to have a chance of advancing, but their lack of attacking threat was evident early on.
Post-Match Reflections: Argentina advanced to the quarter-finals of the Copa America with a place already secured in the group stage.
Peru were eliminated with just one point, their worst performance in the tournament since 1995.
Lautaro Martínez's performance was pivotal, with his goals coming at critical moments to ensure Argentina's progression.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Argentina averaged 74% possession against Peru, matching their second-highest possession rate in the Copa America since 2011.
This was Argentina's 13th victory against Peru in the Copa America, with a clean sheet kept.
Others: The match saw seven penalties taken against Peru in the Copa America, with seven not converted, highlighting the difficulty of converting spot-kicks.
